abstract: This paper proposes a model-based optimization approach for controlling robotic hands, reducing reliance on real-time sensor feedback and improving task execution speed and accuracy in dynamic environments.

title: Dexterous Hand Manipulation via Multi-Task Reinforcement Learning
abstract: This work presents a multi-task reinforcement learning framework for dexterous hand manipulation, where the robot learns to perform multiple object manipulation tasks in a shared environment. The approach improves sample efficiency and generalization across tasks.

title: Imitation Learning for Dexterous Manipulation Using Human Demonstrations and Neural Policies
abstract: This paper introduces an imitation learning approach that leverages human demonstration data to train neural policies for dexterous hand manipulation. The method demonstrates high performance in tasks requiring fine-grained control and object interaction.

title: Optimization-Based Imitation Learning for Dexterous Object Manipulation
abstract: We present an optimization-based imitation learning framework that enhances the performance of dexterous hand manipulation by refining policy parameters through gradient-based optimization techniques.

title: Deep Reinforcement Learning for Dexterous Hand Manipulation with Sparse Rewards
abstract: This study addresses the challenge of sparse reward signals in dexterous hand manipulation tasks using advanced deep reinforcement learning techniques. The proposed method achieves efficient learning with minimal supervision.

title: Adaptive Control Strategies for Dexterous Robotic Hands in Dynamic Environments
abstract: This research develops adaptive control strategies for dexterous robotic hands operating in dynamic and uncertain environments. The proposed method enhances robustness and adaptability through online parameter estimation and control adjustment.

title: Efficient Optimization Techniques for Dexterous Hand Motion Planning
abstract: This paper introduces efficient optimization techniques for motion planning in dexterous robotic hands. The approach reduces computational complexity while maintaining high-quality trajectories for complex manipulation tasks.

title: End-to-End Reinforcement Learning for Complex Grasping and Manipulation
abstract: The paper presents an end-to-end reinforcement learning framework for complex grasping and manipulation tasks. It leverages high-dimensional sensory inputs and learns policies that generalize across different objects and environments.

title: Imitating Human Motor Skills for Dexterous Hand Control
abstract: This paper investigates imitation learning techniques to replicate human motor skills in robotic hands. The study demonstrates how motion capture data can be used to train robotic systems for precise and dexterous manipulation.

title: Robust Control of Dexterous Hands Using Model Predictive Control and Online Optimization
abstract: The paper investigates the use of model predictive control combined with online optimization for robust and real-time control of dexterous robotic hands in dynamic scenarios.

authors: Daniel M. A. S. de Almeida
abstract: This research focuses on optimizing policies for dexterous manipulation tasks in continuous action spaces, leveraging advanced optimization techniques to improve sample efficiency and performance.

title: End-to-End Imitation Learning for Dexterous Hand Manipulation with Uncertainty Estimation
abstract: This work develops an end-to-end imitation learning framework that incorporates uncertainty estimation to improve the generalization and reliability of dexterous hand manipulation policies.

title: Learning Dexterous Manipulation from Human Demonstrations with Imitation Learning and Neural Radiance Fields
abstract: This work combines imitation learning with neural radiance fields to learn dexterous hand manipulation from human demonstrations. The approach enables high-fidelity reconstruction of object shapes and precise control of hand movements.

title: Multi-Task Reinforcement Learning for Dexterous Object Handling in Cluttered Environments
abstract: The paper presents a multi-task reinforcement learning approach that enables robotic hands to handle objects in cluttered environments by learning shared representations across different manipulation tasks.

abstract: This paper introduces a vision-and-action transformer model that uses language guidance to perform dexterous manipulation tasks, enabling more interpretable and controllable robotic behavior.

title: Dexterous Manipulation with Vision and Language Guidance via Multimodal Reinforcement Learning
abstract: This paper proposes a multimodal reinforcement learning framework that integrates vision and language to enable dexterous manipulation tasks. The model learns to interpret natural language instructions and visual inputs to perform complex object manipulation.

title: Optimal Trajectory Planning for Dexterous Manipulation with Model Predictive Control
abstract: We propose an optimal trajectory planning method for dexterous manipulation using model predictive control (MPC). The approach ensures smooth and collision-free motions by optimizing future states based on a learned dynamics model.

title: End-to-End Learning for Dexterous Object Manipulation Using Deep Reinforcement Learning
abstract: We develop an end-to-end deep reinforcement learning system for dexterous object manipulation, capable of learning complex motor skills without explicit reward shaping. The model is trained in simulation and transferred to real-world robotic platforms.

title: Efficient Imitation Learning for Robotic Hand Manipulation with Sparse Expert Data
abstract: This paper explores efficient imitation learning techniques for robotic hand manipulation using sparse expert demonstrations. We introduce a novel policy distillation method that significantly reduces the amount of required expert data while maintaining high performance.

title: Multimodal Action Recognition for Dexterous Hand Manipulation Using Vision-Language-Action Models
abstract: We present a multimodal action recognition system for robotic hands that uses vision-language-action (VLA) models to interpret complex manipulation tasks. The model is trained on a diverse set of task descriptions and visual inputs to improve generalization and robustness.

title: End-to-End Optimization for Dexterous Manipulation with Joint Action and Perception Planning
abstract: The paper introduces an end-to-end optimization framework that jointly plans actions and perception for dexterous hand manipulation. This approach improves the coordination between visual input and motor output during complex tasks.

title: End-to-End Imitation Learning for Robotic Hand Manipulation with Sparse Feedback
abstract: The paper presents an end-to-end imitation learning approach that can learn from sparse sensory feedback, enabling dexterous hand manipulation in environments with limited sensor availability.

title: Vision-Conditioned Language Actions for Dexterous Manipulation
abstract: This paper introduces a vision-conditioned language action model that allows robotic hands to perform dexterous manipulation based on visual input and natural language commands, improving generalization across tasks.

title: Real-Time Optimization for Dexterous Grasping and Manipulation
abstract: This work develops a real-time optimization framework for grasping and manipulation tasks, focusing on dynamic and uncertain environments. The approach is implemented on a physical robotic hand and shows improved performance over traditional methods.

title: Deep Reinforcement Learning for Dexterous Manipulation with Contact-Aware Policies
abstract: This paper proposes a contact-aware deep reinforcement learning approach for dexterous hand manipulation, which explicitly considers contact forces during policy training to improve task success and safety.

title: Learning Dexterous Manipulation with Vision and Touch via Hierarchical Reinforcement Learning
abstract: This paper proposes a hierarchical reinforcement learning framework that integrates visual and tactile feedback to enable dexterous manipulation tasks. The approach improves the sample efficiency and robustness of learning complex hand motions.

title: Efficient Optimization for Dexterous Hand Control Using Model Predictive Control
abstract: This work presents an efficient optimization framework for dexterous hand control using model predictive control (MPC), enhancing both speed and precision in complex manipulation tasks.

title: Deep Reinforcement Learning for Dexterous Hand Manipulation in Dynamic Environments
abstract: This study applies deep reinforcement learning to dexterous hand manipulation in dynamic environments, demonstrating robustness against perturbations and improving adaptability to changing task conditions.

title: Multi-Task Reinforcement Learning for Dexterous Manipulation with Partial Observations
abstract: This paper addresses the challenge of dexterous manipulation under partial observations by proposing a multi-task reinforcement learning approach that improves generalization across different tasks and environments.

title: Efficient Optimization for Robotic Hand Control with Model Predictive Control
abstract: This paper proposes an efficient optimization framework for robotic hand control using model predictive control (MPC). The method improves the stability and accuracy of hand movements during complex manipulation tasks.

title: Deep Reinforcement Learning for Object Reorientation with a Robotic Hand
abstract: This paper presents a deep reinforcement learning approach for object reorientation with a robotic hand. The method learns to rotate objects in 3D space using sparse reward signals and demonstrates robustness across different object shapes.

title: Model-Based Control for Dexterous Robotic Hands Using Real-Time Optimization
abstract: We propose a model-based control framework for dexterous robotic hands that uses real-time optimization to adjust hand movements dynamically. The approach improves the accuracy and adaptability of manipulation tasks in uncertain environments.

abstract: This work focuses on imitation learning for dexterous hand control by leveraging human demonstrations. We propose a data-efficient imitation learning algorithm that enables the robotic hand to replicate complex hand movements observed from human experts.

abstract: We present a vision-based reinforcement learning approach for dexterous hand manipulation, where the robot learns to grasp and manipulate objects using only visual input. The method is evaluated on multiple object manipulation tasks in a simulated environment.

title: End-to-End Learning of Dexterous Manipulation with Visual Feedback
abstract: This paper presents an end-to-end learning framework for dexterous manipulation using visual feedback. The model is trained using a combination of reinforcement learning and visual perception to achieve precise object manipulation.

abstract: We apply neural architecture search (NAS) to optimize the control policies for dexterous robotic hands, resulting in improved performance on a range of manipulation tasks. The approach reduces the need for manual design of neural network structures.

abstract: This paper presents an optimization-based control framework for dexterous hand manipulation, focusing on real-time trajectory planning and force control. The approach is validated on a high-degree-of-freedom robotic hand in various manipulation scenarios.

title: Imitating Human-like Dexterous Manipulation through Imitation Learning
abstract: This work focuses on imitation learning for dexterous hand manipulation, where we train a robotic hand to replicate human-like movements using motion capture data. The results show improved success rates in object reorientation tasks.

title: Learning to Grasp and Manipulate with Imitation Learning and Neural Radiance Fields
abstract: This paper combines imitation learning with neural radiance fields to enhance the perception and manipulation capabilities of dexterous robotic hands. The approach improves the accuracy of object localization and grasp execution in cluttered environments.

title: Adaptive Control of Dexterous Hands Using Online Optimization and Model Predictive Control
abstract: This research proposes an adaptive control strategy that combines online optimization with model predictive control for dexterous robotic hands. The method improves robustness and adaptability in dynamic and uncertain environments.

title: Efficient Optimization for Dexterous Manipulation Tasks with Contact-Aware Planning
abstract: We develop an efficient optimization algorithm that incorporates contact-aware planning for dexterous manipulation. The approach improves task execution by considering physical interactions between the hand and objects during motion planning.

abstract: We present an optimization framework for planning dexterous manipulation tasks that explicitly accounts for contact constraints between the robotic hand and objects. The method enhances task success by generating physically feasible motion plans.

abstract: We introduce a hierarchical imitation learning approach that mimics human skills for dexterous object manipulation. The model learns both low-level motor policies and high-level task planning, enabling efficient and adaptive manipulation in complex scenarios.

title: Imitating Human-like Dexterous Manipulation with Neural Imitation Learning
abstract: This paper explores neural imitation learning techniques to replicate human-like dexterous manipulation skills in robotic hands. The approach is validated through multiple object manipulation tasks.

title: A Vision-Language-Action Framework for Robotic Manipulation Tasks
abstract: This paper introduces a vision-language-action (VLA) framework that enables robots to perform complex manipulation tasks by integrating visual perception, natural language instructions, and motor actions.

title: Control Policies for Dexterous Manipulation Using Deep Reinforcement Learning
abstract: This paper presents a deep reinforcement learning approach for training control policies that enable precise dexterous manipulation. The method is tested on multiple robotic platforms and achieves high task success rates.

title: Model-Based Control for Dexterous Robotic Hands Using Deep Neural Networks
abstract: This research proposes a model-based control strategy using deep neural networks to enhance the precision and adaptability of robotic hands during manipulation tasks. The method is validated on real-world robotic platforms.

title: Optimization-Based Methods for Dexterous Object Manipulation in Dynamic Environments
abstract: This paper presents an optimization-based framework for dexterous hand manipulation that adapts to dynamic environmental changes. The approach uses real-time optimization to adjust grasp configurations and movement plans.

title: Multi-Modal Imitation Learning for Dexterous Manipulation with Visual and Tactile Feedback
abstract: This paper introduces a multi-modal imitation learning framework that leverages both visual and tactile data to improve the accuracy of robotic dexterous manipulation. The model is trained on a diverse set of human demonstrations.

title: Robust Control Strategies for Dexterous Robotic Hands in Uncertain Environments
abstract: This paper presents robust control strategies for dexterous robotic hands operating in uncertain and dynamic environments. The methods improve adaptability and reliability during object manipulation tasks.

title: A Vision-Language-Action Framework for Dexterous Manipulation Tasks
abstract: This paper proposes a vision-language-action framework that integrates vision, language, and action for dexterous manipulation tasks. The model is trained on multimodal data and shows promising results in executing complex instructions with robotic hands.

title: Efficient Optimization for Dexterous Manipulation Using Model Predictive Control
abstract: This paper introduces an efficient optimization framework for dexterous manipulation using model predictive control. The approach balances accuracy and computational efficiency, making it suitable for real-time applications.

title: Optimization Techniques for Dexterous Hand Grasping and Manipulation
abstract: This paper explores optimization-based methods for improving grasping and manipulation performance in dexterous robotic hands. The proposed techniques enhance stability and reduce computational overhead while maintaining high task success rates.

title: Imitation Learning for Dexterous Object Manipulation with Human Demonstrations
abstract: This paper investigates imitation learning for dexterous object manipulation using human demonstration data. The approach enables robotic hands to replicate complex manipulation skills through supervised learning and policy distillation.

title: Adaptive Control for Dexterous Hands Using Online Optimization
abstract: An adaptive control strategy is proposed for dexterous robotic hands, which uses online optimization to adjust control parameters in real-time for improved manipulation accuracy and stability.

title: Efficient Optimization of Dexterous Manipulation Policies with Gradient-Based Methods
abstract: This paper investigates gradient-based optimization techniques for improving the performance of dexterous manipulation policies, focusing on reducing training time while maintaining high task success rates.

title: Multi-Task Reinforcement Learning for Dexterous Manipulation with Shared Representations
abstract: This paper explores multi-task reinforcement learning for dexterous hands, where shared representations are learned across different manipulation tasks to improve sample efficiency and generalization.

title: Optimization Strategies for Dexterous Manipulation in Uncertain Environments
abstract: This research examines optimization strategies for dexterous manipulation under uncertainty. The proposed methods enhance the efficiency and reliability of robotic hand operations in dynamic settings.

title: End-to-End Reinforcement Learning for Dexterous Grasping and Manipulation
abstract: The paper presents an end-to-end reinforcement learning approach for dexterous grasping and manipulation. The model is trained in simulation and transferred to real-world robotic hands, demonstrating strong generalization capabilities.

title: Imitation Learning for Complex Hand Manipulation Tasks Using Neural Networks
abstract: This paper investigates the use of neural networks for imitation learning in complex hand manipulation tasks. The method enables robotic hands to learn from expert demonstrations, achieving high accuracy in object manipulation scenarios.

title: Multimodal Learning for Dexterous Manipulation: A Vision-Language-Action Perspective
abstract: This paper explores the integration of vision, language, and action modalities for dexterous manipulation. The proposed model enhances task understanding and execution by combining multiple sources of information.

title: Robust Control of Dexterous Robotic Hands Using Adaptive Model Predictive Control
abstract: This paper introduces an adaptive model predictive control (MPC) approach for controlling dexterous robotic hands. The method improves robustness and adaptability in uncertain environments through online parameter estimation.

title: Imitation Learning for Dexterous Manipulation with Human Demonstrations
abstract: This study investigates the use of imitation learning for training a robotic hand to perform dexterous manipulation tasks by learning from human demonstrations. The model generalizes well to new objects and environments.

title: Optimization Techniques for Dexterous Object Grasping and Manipulation
abstract: This paper explores optimization techniques for improving grasping and manipulation performance in dexterous robotic hands. The proposed methods enhance efficiency and accuracy in complex tasks.

title: Policy Optimization with Safe Exploration for Dexterous Manipulation
abstract: A safe exploration algorithm is introduced for policy optimization in dexterous manipulation, ensuring reliable learning while minimizing damage to the robotic system or environment.

title: Multi-Task Reinforcement Learning for Dexterous Manipulation Tasks
abstract: This paper proposes a multi-task reinforcement learning framework that allows a robotic hand to learn and transfer skills across different dexterous manipulation tasks effectively.

title: Learning to Grasp from Demonstrations: A Imitation Learning Approach for Dexterous Hands
abstract: We present an imitation learning framework that enables a robotic hand to learn complex grasping behaviors by observing human demonstrations, achieving high success rates on unseen objects.

title: Vision-Based Imitation Learning for Robotic Hand Manipulation with Sparse Feedback
abstract: This paper presents a vision-based imitation learning approach that works with sparse feedback signals, enabling efficient learning of dexterous hand manipulation from limited human demonstrations.

title: Optimized Policy Search for Dexterous Manipulation in High-Dimensional Spaces
abstract: This paper proposes an optimized policy search algorithm tailored for high-dimensional dexterous manipulation tasks. The method improves convergence and stability compared to traditional policy gradient approaches.

title: Model-Free Reinforcement Learning for Dexterous Hand Manipulation with Multi-Task Learning
abstract: This study applies multi-task reinforcement learning to dexterous hand manipulation, allowing the model to learn multiple tasks simultaneously and generalize better across different objects and conditions.

title: Learning to Manipulate with Vision and Language: A Vision-Language-Action Approach for Dexterous Hand Control
abstract: This paper introduces a vision-language-action (VLA) model that enables dexterous hand manipulation by combining visual perception, language instructions, and action execution. The model is trained on a large-scale dataset of human demonstrations and shows strong performance in complex object manipulation tasks.

title: Dexterous Manipulation via Hierarchical Reinforcement Learning with Dynamic Policy Adaptation
abstract: This work proposes a hierarchical reinforcement learning framework that allows robotic hands to adapt their policies dynamically during manipulation tasks. The approach improves sample efficiency and task success rates in high-dimensional control settings.

title: Imitation Learning for Dexterous Object Manipulation Using Multimodal Imitation Data
abstract: This paper presents an imitation learning method that leverages multimodal data (vision, force, and motion) to train a dexterous robotic hand. The model achieves high fidelity in replicating human-like manipulation behaviors.

title: Optimal Control for Dexterous Hand Manipulation Using Model Predictive Control with Learned Dynamics
abstract: This research explores the use of model predictive control (MPC) with learned dynamics models for precise and stable dexterous hand manipulation. The method enhances control accuracy and robustness in real-world scenarios.

title: Efficient Optimization for Dexterous Manipulation through Gradient-Based Policy Search
abstract: This paper introduces a gradient-based optimization technique for improving policy performance in dexterous hand manipulation tasks. The method reduces training time while maintaining high task success rates.

title: Optimal Motion Planning for Dexterous Manipulation with Contact Constraints
abstract: We present an optimal motion planning algorithm that accounts for contact forces and friction during dexterous hand manipulation. The approach ensures safe and effective execution of complex tasks.

title: Vision-Based Action Recognition for Dexterous Manipulation Tasks
abstract: We develop a vision-based action recognition system that identifies and executes fine-grained manipulation actions using a robotic hand. The system is trained on a large-scale dataset of human and robotic hand movements.

title: Learning Dexterous Manipulation via Multi-Task Reinforcement Learning
abstract: We explore multi-task reinforcement learning for dexterous hand manipulation, where a single policy learns to perform multiple object manipulation tasks. The results show improved sample efficiency and task generalization.

title: End-to-End Reinforcement Learning for Complex Object Manipulation
abstract: We develop an end-to-end reinforcement learning system for dexterous hand manipulation that learns to perform complex object manipulation tasks without explicit reward shaping. The method is tested on a wide range of tasks with promising results.

title: Learning Dexterous Manipulation Policies with Large Language Models
abstract: This paper explores the use of large language models as a basis for learning dexterous manipulation policies. The model is trained to understand natural language instructions and translate them into precise robotic actions.

title: Learning Dexterous Manipulation via Imitation Learning with Human Demonstrations
abstract: We propose an imitation learning framework that enables a robotic hand to learn dexterous manipulation from human demonstrations. The model is trained on a large dataset of human hand movements and successfully transfers to real-world robotic platforms.

title: End-to-End Imitation Learning for Dexterous Hand Manipulation with Contact-Rich Environments
abstract: This work addresses the challenge of imitating complex dexterous hand movements in contact-rich environments using end-to-end imitation learning. The proposed method achieves robust performance across a wide range of objects and tasks.

title: Optimization-Based Policy Learning for Dexterous Object Manipulation
abstract: This paper proposes an optimization-based policy learning framework that improves the performance of dexterous manipulation tasks by directly optimizing the policy through gradient-based methods.

title: Adaptive Control of Dexterous Robotic Hands Using Online Optimization
abstract: This paper presents an online optimization-based control strategy for dexterous robotic hands, which adapts to changing environmental conditions and improves task performance in real-time.

title: Efficient Policy Optimization for Dexterous Manipulation with Model-Based Reinforcement Learning
abstract: We propose a model-based reinforcement learning approach that improves the efficiency of policy optimization for dexterous hand manipulation tasks, reducing the need for extensive training data.

title: Efficient Imitation Learning for Robotic Hand Skills
abstract: This paper presents an efficient imitation learning algorithm that reduces training time while maintaining high performance in dexterous hand manipulation tasks.

title: Reinforcement Learning with Curriculum for Complex Manipulation Tasks
abstract: We introduce a curriculum learning strategy for reinforcement learning that enables robotic hands to learn complex manipulation tasks step-by-step, improving sample efficiency and success rate.

title: A Vision-Based Optimization Framework for Dexterous Manipulation
abstract: This paper proposes a vision-based optimization framework that combines real-time visual feedback with optimization techniques to enhance dexterous manipulation performance.

title: Language-Guided Reinforcement Learning for Robotic Manipulation
abstract: We explore the use of language as a reward signal in reinforcement learning for robotic manipulation, enabling the robot to perform tasks based on natural language instructions.

title: Optimizing Contact Forces for Dexterous Object Manipulation
abstract: We propose an optimization-based method to compute optimal contact forces for dexterous hand manipulation. The approach improves stability and reduces slipping during object manipulation tasks.

title: Efficient Optimization for Dexterous Manipulation via Gradient-Based Methods
abstract: We propose a gradient-based optimization technique for dexterous hand manipulation that improves convergence speed and task success rate by leveraging accurate dynamic modeling and efficient gradient computation.

title: Learning to Manipulate with Multi-Modal Reinforcement Learning
abstract: We develop a multi-modal reinforcement learning system that combines visual, tactile, and proprioceptive inputs for more effective dexterous manipulation. The model achieves superior performance on a variety of object handling tasks.

title: End-to-End Imitation Learning for Complex Object Manipulation
abstract: This work explores end-to-end imitation learning techniques for dexterous hand manipulation, demonstrating the ability to learn complex object manipulation skills from unstructured human demonstrations without explicit reward functions.

title: End-to-End Learning of Dexterous Manipulation with Multi-Modal Feedback
abstract: This paper explores end-to-end learning of dexterous manipulation using multi-modal feedback including vision, force, and proprioception. The proposed architecture enables robust manipulation in unstructured environments, demonstrated through a series of object sorting and assembly tasks.

title: Imitation Learning for Dexterous Object Handling with Neural Radiance Fields
abstract: This paper introduces a novel imitation learning framework that uses neural radiance fields (NeRFs) to represent 3D scenes for more accurate imitation of dexterous object handling tasks. The model significantly improves the quality of learned policies in complex visual environments.

title: Language-Guided Dexterous Manipulation with Vision-Action Transformers
abstract: This paper presents a vision-action transformer model that allows language-guided dexterous manipulation by integrating visual input with natural language instructions. The model is trained on a large-scale dataset of human-robot interactions and achieves strong performance on instruction-following tasks.

title: Robust Control of Dexterous Hands via Model Predictive Control with Learned Uncertainty Bounds
abstract: This paper develops a model predictive control (MPC) framework for dexterous hands that incorporates learned uncertainty bounds to improve robustness in dynamic and uncertain environments. The method is validated on a physical robotic hand performing object manipulation tasks.

title: Efficient Optimization for Dexterous Manipulation Policies Using Gradient-Based Methods
abstract: This paper investigates gradient-based optimization techniques for improving the performance of dexterous manipulation policies. The proposed method reduces training time while maintaining high task success rates, as demonstrated on a variety of object manipulation tasks.

title: Optimizing Dexterous Manipulation through Joint Policy and Dynamics Learning
abstract: This paper proposes a joint policy and dynamics learning framework for dexterous manipulation. The approach improves control performance by simultaneously learning the policy and modeling the system dynamics.

title: Model-Based Reinforcement Learning for Dexterous Hand Control
abstract: We present a model-based reinforcement learning approach for dexterous hand control, where the model is used to predict future states and optimize control actions, leading to faster learning and better generalization.

title: Vision-Based Imitation Learning for Dexterous Hand Manipulation
abstract: We introduce a vision-based imitation learning framework for dexterous hand manipulation. The model learns from human demonstrations using visual inputs and achieves high accuracy in replicating complex hand movements without explicit reward functions.

title: Optimal Control for Dexterous Hand Manipulation Using Model Predictive Control
abstract: This paper proposes an optimal control strategy for dexterous hand manipulation using model predictive control (MPC). The approach improves task execution by optimizing control signals in real-time while respecting physical constraints.

title: Language-Guided Reinforcement Learning for Dexterous Manipulation Tasks
abstract: This paper introduces a language-guided reinforcement learning approach for dexterous manipulation. By incorporating natural language descriptions of tasks, the model can generalize better across different objects and scenarios.

title: End-to-End Learning of Dexterous Manipulation with Vision and Tactile Feedback
abstract: This research focuses on end-to-end learning of dexterous manipulation using both visual and tactile inputs. The proposed method achieves state-of-the-art performance on object regrasping and fine-grained manipulation tasks.

title: Imitation Learning for Complex Grasping and Manipulation Tasks
abstract: This paper investigates the use of imitation learning for complex grasping and manipulation tasks. It introduces a new architecture that enhances the ability of the model to generalize across different object shapes and sizes.

title: A Vision-Language-Action Framework for Multi-Step Object Manipulation
abstract: This paper presents a Vision-Language-Action (VLA) system capable of performing multi-step object manipulation tasks based on natural language instructions. The model demonstrates strong performance on a variety of complex manipulation scenarios.

title: Efficient Control of Dexterous Hands via Model Predictive Control with Learned Dynamics
abstract: This paper explores the application of model predictive control (MPC) for dexterous hand manipulation using learned dynamics models. The approach improves stability and responsiveness during high-speed manipulation tasks.

abstract: This paper presents a reinforcement learning framework that combines vision and tactile feedback for dexterous hand manipulation. The method enables the robot to learn complex object reorientation tasks through trial and error in a simulated environment.

title: Optimizing Dexterous Manipulation Policies via Differentiable Simulation and Gradient Descent
abstract: We propose an optimization-based approach for learning dexterous manipulation policies using differentiable simulation and gradient descent, achieving efficient and accurate policy updates.

title: Efficient Imitation Learning for Dexterous Hand Manipulation Using Hierarchical Policies
abstract: This work introduces a hierarchical imitation learning approach that improves the efficiency and scalability of learning dexterous hand manipulation policies from expert demonstrations.

title: Policy Distillation for Dexterous Manipulation in Sim-to-Real Scenarios
abstract: This paper investigates policy distillation techniques to transfer complex dexterous manipulation policies from simulation to real-world robotic systems, reducing the need for extensive real-world training data.

title: A Unified Framework for Dexterous Manipulation using Vision and Reinforcement Learning
abstract: This paper introduces a unified framework that integrates vision and reinforcement learning for dexterous manipulation tasks, achieving improved performance in object reorientation and grasping scenarios.

title: Dexterous Manipulation with Vision-Based Reinforcement Learning using Sim-to-Real Transfer
abstract: This paper presents a vision-based reinforcement learning approach for dexterous manipulation tasks, demonstrating effective sim-to-real transfer on a robotic hand. The method leverages visual inputs to learn complex grasping and object reorientation policies.

title: Learning Dexterous Manipulation through Imitation of Human Demonstrations with Neural Radiance Fields
abstract: This work explores the use of neural radiance fields to capture detailed human hand motions for imitation learning in robotic dexterity tasks. The model enables accurate replication of fine-grained manipulation skills.

title: Model Predictive Control for Dexterous Hand Manipulation with Uncertainty Quantification
abstract: This paper proposes a model predictive control framework that incorporates uncertainty quantification for robust dexterous manipulation. It is validated on both simulated and real-world robotic hands.

title: Robust Control of Dexterous Hands Using Model-Based Reinforcement Learning
abstract: We propose a model-based reinforcement learning approach for controlling dexterous hands, which enhances stability and performance in dynamic and uncertain environments.

title: Efficient Optimization for Dexterous Hand Grasping and Manipulation
abstract: This paper presents an efficient optimization framework for grasping and manipulation tasks, focusing on minimizing energy consumption while maintaining high task accuracy and robustness.

title: Imitation Learning with Temporal Consistency for Robotic Hand Skills
abstract: We develop a temporal consistency-based imitation learning method that improves the smoothness and reliability of learned hand movements, enabling more natural and effective manipulation behaviors.

title: Efficient Optimization for Dexterous Object Handling
abstract: This paper presents an efficient optimization algorithm for dexterous object handling, focusing on minimizing energy consumption while maintaining task performance in real-time robotic applications.

title: End-to-End Learning for Dexterous Manipulation Using Vision and Touch
abstract: This paper describes an end-to-end learning system that integrates vision and tactile feedback for dexterous manipulation, achieving high accuracy in object manipulation tasks without explicit state estimation.

title: Learning to Grasp from Demonstration: A Imitation Learning Approach for Dexterous Hands
abstract: We propose an imitation learning framework that enables a robotic hand to learn complex grasping skills from human demonstrations, achieving high success rates on unseen objects in simulation and real-world settings.

title: Real-Time Control of Dexterous Hands Using Deep Neural Networks
abstract: We develop a deep neural network-based control system for real-time dexterous hand manipulation, enabling fast and accurate movement execution in dynamic environments.

title: Optimization of Contact Forces for Dexterous Manipulation Using Model-Based Methods
abstract: This paper focuses on optimizing contact forces during dexterous manipulation tasks using model-based optimization techniques, resulting in improved stability and precision in object handling.

title: Imitation Learning with Hierarchical Policies for Robotic Hands
abstract: This study introduces a hierarchical imitation learning framework for robotic hands, where low-level motor skills are learned from demonstrations and high-level task planning is optimized using reinforcement learning.

title: Optimizing Dexterous Manipulation Policies with Differentiable Simulation
abstract: This paper proposes an optimization framework that combines differentiable simulation with policy learning to improve the efficiency and accuracy of dexterous manipulation policies, particularly in tasks requiring precise force control.

title: Multimodal Action Policies for Dexterous Manipulation using Vision-Language-Action Models
abstract: This paper develops multimodal action policies that integrate vision, language, and action for dexterous manipulation. The model is trained on large-scale multimodal datasets and achieves strong performance on complex manipulation tasks.

title: Efficient Optimization for Dexterous Hand Pose Estimation and Manipulation
abstract: This paper introduces an efficient optimization technique for estimating hand poses and planning manipulations. The method reduces computational overhead while maintaining high accuracy in real-time applications.

title: A Vision-Based Reinforcement Learning Framework for Dexterous Object Reorientation
abstract: This paper develops a vision-based reinforcement learning framework that enables a robotic hand to reorient objects in 3D space. The method uses end-to-end learning from visual inputs to achieve high accuracy and robustness.

title: Optimal Control for Dexterous Hand Manipulation with Dynamic Contact Modeling
abstract: This research focuses on optimal control strategies for dexterous hand manipulation, incorporating dynamic contact modeling to improve task execution under varying environmental conditions.

title: Imitating Human Hand Movements via Imitation Learning with Neural Radiance Fields
abstract: This paper introduces an imitation learning framework that leverages neural radiance fields to model human hand movements. The approach enables robotic hands to replicate complex dexterous behaviors by learning from human demonstrations in 3D space.

title: Optimizing Dexterous Manipulation through Joint Action and Perception Planning
abstract: This paper addresses the problem of joint action and perception planning in dexterous manipulation. We propose an optimization-based framework that coordinates sensor input and motor output for more effective object interaction.

abstract: This paper proposes a hierarchical reinforcement learning approach for dexterous object handling. The method decomposes the task into sub-policies, improving sample efficiency and performance in complex manipulation settings.

title: Model-Based Control of Dexterous Hands with Real-Time Optimization
abstract: We present a model-based control framework that integrates real-time optimization for dexterous hand manipulation. The system adapts to changing environments and provides precise control over complex hand motions.

title: Dexterous Manipulation via Deep Reinforcement Learning with Curiosity-driven Exploration
abstract: We propose a reinforcement learning framework that uses intrinsic curiosity to improve exploration in high-dimensional dexterous manipulation tasks. Our method achieves state-of-the-art results on the Dex-Hand benchmark without explicit reward shaping.

title: Imitation Learning for Dexterous Hand Control Using Human Demonstrations and Neural Networks
abstract: This work explores imitation learning for dexterous hand control by training neural networks on human demonstration data. We show that the learned policy can generalize to unseen objects and tasks with minimal fine-tuning.

title: Optimal Control of Dexterous Hands using Model Predictive Control with Learned Dynamics
abstract: This paper introduces a model predictive control approach for dexterous hands that incorporates learned dynamics models. The method improves trajectory tracking and contact handling in complex manipulation scenarios.

title: End-to-End Learning of Dexterous Manipulation Policies Using Reinforcement Learning
abstract: This work proposes an end-to-end reinforcement learning approach for dexterous hand manipulation, where the policy learns directly from raw sensory inputs without manual feature engineering. The method shows strong performance on a variety of object manipulation tasks.

title: Model Predictive Control for Dexterous Hand Manipulation with Uncertainty Estimation
abstract: We present a model predictive control (MPC) framework that incorporates uncertainty estimation for more robust and precise dexterous hand manipulation. The method is validated on both simulated and real-world robotic platforms.

title: Efficient Imitation Learning for Dexterous Robot Hands Using Hierarchical Policies
abstract: We introduce a hierarchical imitation learning framework that enables efficient learning of complex dexterous manipulation skills. The method decomposes tasks into sub-tasks, improving learning stability and execution accuracy.

abstract: This paper presents a vision-language-action planning system that allows robotic hands to perform object manipulation based on natural language instructions. The model combines vision, language, and action planning for flexible and adaptive manipulation.

abstract: This paper explores optimization techniques for real-time control of dexterous robotic hands. The approach focuses on minimizing computational overhead while maintaining high precision and responsiveness in manipulation tasks.

title: Learning Optimal Grasps through Differentiable Optimization in Sim-to-Real Settings
abstract: This work proposes a differentiable optimization approach for learning optimal grasps in sim-to-real settings. The method enables efficient grasp planning and execution on a dexterous robotic hand with minimal real-world data.

title: Learning Dexterous Hand Manipulation through Imitation Learning from Human Demonstrations
abstract: We propose an imitation learning framework that enables a robotic hand to learn complex manipulation tasks by imitating human demonstrations. The model uses a combination of motion capture data and tactile feedback to improve the accuracy of learned policies.

title: Imitating Human Dexterity: A Deep Imitation Learning Approach for Robotic Hands
abstract: This work develops a deep imitation learning framework that mimics human dexterity by learning from high-quality human motion data. The model is applied to robotic hands to perform precise and natural manipulation tasks.

title: Adaptive Control for Dexterous Manipulation Using Model-Free Optimization
abstract: We present an adaptive control strategy that uses model-free optimization to adjust control parameters in real-time during dexterous manipulation tasks. The method improves robustness and adaptability to changing environmental conditions.

title: Efficient Policy Optimization for Dexterous Manipulation Tasks
abstract: This paper proposes an efficient policy optimization method for dexterous hand manipulation, focusing on reducing training time while maintaining high task performance. The approach is validated on a range of complex manipulation scenarios.

title: Model-Based Control of Dexterous Hands Using Deep Neural Networks
abstract: This paper proposes a model-based control strategy using deep neural networks to enhance the precision and stability of dexterous hand movements. The approach is validated on both simulated and real-world robotic platforms.

title: End-to-End Learning for Dexterous Manipulation with Multi-Modal Feedback
abstract: This paper develops an end-to-end learning system that integrates vision, touch, and proprioception for dexterous hand manipulation. The model is trained using reinforcement learning and achieves high success rates in complex tasks.

title: Learning from Demonstrations: Imitation Learning for Robotic Hand Skills
abstract: This study applies imitation learning to teach robotic hands complex manipulation skills using human demonstrations. The approach includes motion prediction and adaptation to novel objects and environments.

title: Imitating Human Hand Movements with Deep Imitation Learning
abstract: This paper presents a deep imitation learning approach that captures human hand movements and transfers them to robotic hands. The method is evaluated on a variety of manipulation tasks, showing high fidelity in replicating human-like motion.

title: Vision-Language-Action Policies for Complex Object Manipulation
abstract: This paper introduces a vision-language-action policy that enables robotic hands to perform complex object manipulation tasks guided by natural language instructions. The model is trained using a combination of vision, language, and action data.

title: From Imitation to Generalization: Learning Dexterous Manipulation from Unstructured Demonstrations
abstract: This study investigates methods to generalize from unstructured human demonstrations to achieve robust dexterous manipulation in unseen scenarios.

title: Adaptive Control for Dexterous Robotic Hands Using Neural Networks
abstract: The paper proposes an adaptive control method using neural networks to improve the responsiveness and precision of dexterous robotic hands in uncertain environments.

title: Adaptive Control for Dexterous Hand Manipulation with Dynamic Environments
abstract: The paper presents an adaptive control strategy for dexterous hand manipulation in uncertain and dynamic environments, improving stability and performance through real-time parameter adjustment.

title: Optimizing Dexterous Manipulation Policies via Bayesian Optimization
abstract: This work applies Bayesian optimization to refine dexterous manipulation policies, achieving better performance with fewer trials compared to traditional optimization methods.

title: Efficient Imitation Learning for Dexterous Manipulation Using Hierarchical Policies
abstract: This study develops a hierarchical imitation learning framework for dexterous hand manipulation, enabling efficient learning from expert demonstrations and generalization across different tasks.

title: A Vision-Language-Action Framework for Multi-Modal Dexterous Manipulation
abstract: This paper introduces a multi-modal VLA framework that combines visual, linguistic, and motor information to perform complex dexterous manipulation tasks with high accuracy.

title: Optimization-Based Control for Dexterous Manipulation with Uncertain Contact Dynamics
abstract: This paper develops an optimization-based control framework that accounts for uncertain contact dynamics, allowing a dexterous robotic hand to perform stable and precise manipulation tasks in dynamic environments.

title: Learning to Grasp and Manipulate with Vision and Language Grounded Policies
abstract: We propose a vision and language grounded policy learning method for grasping and manipulating objects, enabling the robot to understand and execute tasks based on natural language instructions and visual context.

title: Imitation Learning for Dexterous Object Manipulation using Human Demonstrations and Visual Feedback
abstract: We develop an imitation learning framework that leverages human demonstrations and visual feedback to train a dexterous robotic hand for precise object manipulation tasks, demonstrating strong generalization across different objects and environments.

title: Efficient Reinforcement Learning for Robotic Hands Using Hierarchical Policy Networks
abstract: We introduce a hierarchical policy network architecture for reinforcement learning in dexterous hand manipulation, which enables efficient learning of high-level strategies while maintaining fine-grained motor control at the low level.

title: End-to-End Imitation Learning for Dexterous Manipulation with Multi-Modal Sensory Inputs
abstract: We present an end-to-end imitation learning system that integrates multi-modal sensory inputs (vision, force, and tactile) to train a dexterous robotic hand for complex object manipulation tasks.

title: Robust Control Strategies for Dexterous Manipulation with Uncertain Dynamics
abstract: This paper proposes robust control strategies for dexterous robotic hands operating in uncertain environments, focusing on adaptive control and disturbance rejection techniques.

title: Adaptive Control for Dexterous Hand Manipulation with Unknown Contact Dynamics
abstract: This paper introduces an adaptive control strategy for robotic hands operating in environments with unknown contact dynamics, enhancing robustness and precision in manipulation tasks.

title: Learning Dexterous Manipulation Policies via Gradient-Based Optimization with Policy Gradients
abstract: This paper presents a gradient-based optimization method for learning dexterous manipulation policies, demonstrating improved convergence and performance compared to traditional policy gradient methods.

title: Efficient Imitation Learning for Dexterous Manipulation Using Neural Radiance Fields
abstract: This work applies neural radiance fields to improve the quality of imitation learning for dexterous hand manipulation by capturing detailed 3D scene information during demonstration.

title: Robust Control of Dexterous Hands Using Model-Free and Model-Based Hybrid Approaches
abstract: This paper proposes a hybrid control strategy combining model-free and model-based methods to improve the robustness and precision of dexterous hand manipulation under varying environmental conditions.

title: Efficient Optimization for Dexterous Manipulation with Deep Policy Gradients
abstract: We introduce an efficient optimization technique for deep policy gradient methods, significantly improving the training speed and performance of dexterous hand manipulation policies in complex environments.

title: Model Predictive Control for Dexterous Manipulation with Dynamic Contact Constraints
abstract: This paper presents a model predictive control (MPC) approach tailored for dexterous manipulation tasks, incorporating dynamic contact constraints to enhance stability and precision.

title: Learning Dexterous Manipulation Policies from Large-Scale Language-Image Data
abstract: We explore the use of large-scale language-image data to train dexterous manipulation policies, enabling robotic hands to understand and execute complex tasks based on natural language descriptions.

title: Imitation Learning for Robotic Hand Manipulation Using Human Demonstrations and Semantic Contexts
abstract: This paper introduces a method for imitation learning that leverages human demonstrations combined with semantic context to improve the performance of robotic hands in object manipulation tasks.

title: Optimizing Dexterous Manipulation through Model-Based Control and Real-Time Planning
abstract: We develop a model-based control framework that integrates real-time planning to optimize dexterous manipulation tasks, improving both accuracy and efficiency in dynamic environments.

title: Efficient Optimization of Contact-rich Manipulation Tasks Using Probabilistic Models
abstract: This paper proposes an optimization framework that uses probabilistic models to handle contact-rich manipulation scenarios, enabling more robust and stable interactions with objects.

title: Vision-Language-Action Policies for Dexterous Object Manipulation in Unstructured Environments
abstract: We introduce a vision-language-action (VLA) policy that enables robotic hands to perform complex manipulation tasks by interpreting natural language instructions and visual input in unstructured settings.

title: Multi-Task Reinforcement Learning for Dexterous Hand Manipulation using Shared Representations
abstract: We propose a multi-task reinforcement learning framework that leverages shared representations across different dexterous manipulation tasks, improving sample efficiency and generalization performance.

title: End-to-End Reinforcement Learning for Dexterous Object Manipulation with Contact-Aware Policies
abstract: We develop an end-to-end reinforcement learning framework that explicitly considers contact dynamics during dexterous manipulation. The method achieves high success rates on challenging object manipulation tasks in simulation and real-world settings.

title: Vision-Language-Action Planning for Dexterous Hand Manipulation
abstract: This paper presents a vision-language-action planning framework that enables a robotic hand to execute complex manipulation tasks based on natural language commands. The system integrates perception, planning, and control modules for seamless execution.

title: Learning Dexterous Manipulation Policies through Imitation and Reinforcement Learning
